title: Renewable Energy Technology Curriculum Design: Instructional Strategy Development Based on Structural Coding Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science knowledge (physics, chemistry), renewable energy fundamentals, and instructional design experience
context.additional_context: A course where in-service practitioners acquire field-applicable teaching methods by designing renewable energy education modules.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately classify and explain six core knowledge areas related to renewable energy technologies (solar, wind, hydrogen, geothermal, biomass, energy storage).
Learners can design educational content tailored to learner levels using structural coding analysis techniques.
Learners can develop project-based assessment tools incorporating technical elements such as energy conversion efficiency, system design, and environmental impact evaluation.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
